Text.Value: Great idea. Go right ahead.
There is nothing better than leaving in a blaze of glory.
An intellectual dilemma to round off the evening? Sounds just the thing.
We haven't yet learned what the crown might be capable of. I thought you wanted to find out?
Destroy an entire city? Sounds wonderful - go ahead.
A city snuffed out in one moment: it will be a beautiful offering for Bhaal.
Careful. You don't know what I'm about to ask.
You know I'll always help you.
A passing fancy, one that has lost its lustre. No - unleashing the power within me will be far more magnificent than some crown.

EditorData.NodeContext: dismissing his old opinion, growwing fervour/intensity - he's excited by this idea

Text.Value: Most foolish. Wanton violence against your dear Gale? After all, the man has a budding apocalypse tucked beside his heart - you would provoke it?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player readies their weapon, but Gale throws up a hand. The player hesitates.

Text.Value: The inevitable has been delayed far too long already - no more, I say. It's time to make a stand.
That may be, but has it put a stop to the Absolute? Or cured us of our tadpoles?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DG] Laezel (Orin) transforms into her true form.

Text.Value: Just a bit of late-night humour for you. Your input would be most welcome.
It wouldn't only kill Absolutists - it would kill everyone. You can't be serious.
As always, I'm grateful for your enthusiasm. And yes, it will require some amount of brutality on our part.
So quick to turn on your friends... a sure sign of an unsound mind, and a villainous heart.
You think I've been holding back this whole time?
Act now, and we take out the brain and every footsoldier in the Absolute's army. All their hatred, their bile, their violence - erased. It would finally be over.
Forgive me. I was lost in my thoughts, as usual.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: As the player enters camp, Gale stands gazing into the fire. He looks lost, brooding. Hearing the player approach, he turns to greet them.

Text.Value: A puzzle for the mind, I'd solve quite comfortably. Unfortunately, this is a struggle for the heart.
Of course! I find them to be almost the same quality as my own.
Caeci verum videant.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale assumes a spell-casting pose, muttering a strange incantation. He begins to glow fiercely. The player braces themselves agains a brilliant flash of magic. The player staggers, then realises they're unharmed. They open their eyes, dazed. Instead of Gale, it is now Orin stood before us.
EditorData.NodeContext: Latin spellcasting, pronounced 'Kay-see ver-um vid-eh-ant' ('let the blind see the truth')
EditorData.SFXTags: [AK] Gale supernova SFX, but the bright light fades out after becasue it's a fake explosion
EditorData.VFXTags: [AK] Gale supernova VFX, but the bright light fades out after becasue it's a fake explosion

Text.Value: What do you mean by 'drastic'?
We both know the orb I carry inside me is powerful enough to burn away the Absolute's blight in an instant.
There isn't.
Attack.
You wouldn't dare.
Wouldn't I?
I know how much power rests within me - enough to turn Baldur's Gate to ashes, its memory to no more than a children's fable.
Please, Gale. You're better than this.
I regret straying from Mystra's instruction. All the suffering around us, it is our fault. I am reconsidering taking a more drastic approach.
I'm afraid to say I have been holding back. Every. Single. Day.
Gods damned if I'm going to let it be for nothing. If Mystra gave me one purpose, it was this: to destroy Baldur's Gate, and the Absolute with it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Determined, this is the right thing to do

Text.Value: There is another way Gale!
Try it, and you'll be dead before you utter your first syllable.
I fear our unwillingness to make difficult decisions is doing more harm than good.
I've found myself in something of a quandry. Yours is an opinion I'd gladly hear on the matter.
All we've done is delay the inevitable, a delay that puts thousands more lives at risk. But those lives can be saved.
So gentle. You think saving him will stop the bloodshed? It won't.
Why change course now?
With pleasure.
But I thought you had your heart set on the Crown of Karsus? A difficult thing to aspire to, if you're dead.
But what stays my hand? Obstinacy? Misplaced morals? Simple fear of dying? You?
Of course. What's on your mind?
If 'drastic' means violent, then count me in.
The day will come when I lose control of the power within me anyway. There's nothing you or I can do to stop that.
So be it. End this, once and for all.
What makes you think it will work?
Kill me, and I'll destroy the city anyway.
Sounds a bit heavy for so late an hour. Another time.
Wait. What I have to say... well, there may not be another chance. Please.
I didn't know you thought so highly of my opinions.
Deadly serious. This is the burden we must carry - to condemn the few to save the many, or Baldur's Gate will only be the first city to fall.
I disagree. Using restraint has kept us alive so far.
My apologies. I shouldn't place my own guilt onto your shoulders.
Every day we spend inching our way towards our enemies is a day we choose to let countless die in the Absolute's path.
There's no need for anything so drastic. You thought the Crown of Karsus was worth pursuing...

Synopsis:
The first longrest in Undercity, Orin will abduct one of the players companion. (Lae’zel, Halsin, Gale or Minthara). Based on the players approval rating with them. (Friend, Good Friend and Romance) Highest approval will be the highest priority.

She will appear in camp impersonating her abducted victim and toy with the players. Shortly after, she grows tire of the game and reveals herself. And gives her ultimatum - Kill Gortash and retrieve his Netherstone - and bring it to her at her Bhaal Temple. Or the abducted companion dies. She will then teleport away.
